title: Is Eric Clapton technically an amazing guitar player compared to others? - Quora

response.answer_text: This answer depends upon how the term “technical” is being used in the question. If the question is to compare how virtuosic his technique is in comparison to other players, then the answer is no. He is not particularly notable. If the question refers to other aspects of him, such as his tone-crafting, improvisational skills, ability to pull off a performance at any time, etc., then he is clearly one of the best. He is more artist than craftsman. The area that I have always debated is his improvisational skill, which while pleasing to the ear, is rather limited. Clapton has always stuck to working with stock phrases and clichés. He admitted as much when he was a young man, as being something of the formula for his approach. Other guitarists who traveled in the same circles (particularly Beck and Gilmour) are far more adventurous as improvisors. Clapton never really bought into the “Clapton Is God” thing, but he did have a host of personal issues which made him somewhat unapproachable and unpleasant in his earlier life. He’s dealt with a lot of that, and seems much happier now. He is probably one of the best ambassadors that the electric guitar has. At the same time, we should be honest. His place in popular culture has to do with his bonafides as a pop star, not a blues artist. As a blues guitarist, he falls seriously short.
